p: In our cohort, among those with empirical coverage for atypical pathogens, 88% were given doxycycline. The use of doxycycline as part of a combination therapy for CAP for coverage of atypical pathogens was less well evaluated, compared with macrolide or respiratory fluoroquinolones [ 4]. In a retrospective study in San Francisco, empirical ceftriaxone and doxycycline reduced in-patient and 30-day mortality in patients hospitalized for CAP, compared with other antibiotic regimens [ 21]. In another retrospective study in Australia, doxycycline was shown to have comparable effects on outcomes compared with macrolide, both of which were used in combination with beta-lactam therapy in patients hospitalized with CAP [ 22].
